Sentece: The globule size and average viscosity of the optimized MEs-Ap were 99.34 nm and 1.7 mPa·s, respectively, which was oil-in-water microemulsion without serious irritation or allergy for skin.
Title: Development and Evaluation of Topical Delivery of Microemulsions Containing Adapalene (MEs-Ap) for Acne.
Name: Adapalene

Title: Development and Evaluation of Topical Delivery of Microemulsions Containing Adapalene (MEs-Ap) for Acne.
Name: Adapalene

Sentece: The Js, Qn, and Qretention of MEs-Ap (0.81 ± 0.19 μg/cm2/h, 24.73 ± 4.24 μg/cm2, 2.08 ± 0.18 μg/cm2) were apparently higher than Differin® (0.022 ± 0.009 μg/cm2/h, 0.536 ± 0.103 μg/cm2, and 0.523 ± 0.130 μg/cm2) respectively.

Sentece: The local bioavailability study showed that the AUC0 → 36h of the MEs-Ap in the dermal (19.6 ± 1.22 μg/cm2) was significantly improved comparing to Differin® (13.9 ± 1.73 μg/cm2) (p < 0.01).
Title: Development and Evaluation of Topical Delivery of Microemulsions Containing Adapalene (MEs-Ap) for Acne.
Name: Adapalene
